meanings.definition: To free from entailment or restriction.
meanings.sent1: She disentailed the property from the family restrictions.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer helped disentail the land from the legal ties.
meanings.sent3: After much paperwork, they were finally able to disentail the house from the old rules.
meanings.sent4: The new law allowed them to disentail the business from outdated regulations.
meanings.sent5: With determination, they managed to disentail the company from financial constraints.

meanings.definition: To release from a legal entail.
meanings.sent1: He decided to disentail the estate from the legal obligations.
meanings.sent2: The court order allowed them to disentail the property from the family trust.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer joked that he could disentail the car from the parking ticket.
meanings.sent4: The new legislation would disentail the company from any previous debts.
meanings.sent5: The team worked hard to disentail the project from any delays.
